poem:
Screaming Symbols  
  
A concert hall fills,  
music rising like a tide,  
yet on the glowing screen, a clash—  
symbols misunderstood, eyes wide.  
A swastika, a Star,  
both ancient, both scarred.  
We stand, learn to discern,  
from a cacophony repeat,  
how harmony is hard.
